A C++ template metaprogramming library designed to provide compile time implementations of common STL and functional programming functions, as well as allowing user-defined metafunctions to be easily implemented using the functions provided by nano

Nano A C++ template metaprogramming library

About

Nano is a C++ template metaprogramming library. It was originally created so that I could learn template metaprogramming, but as I explored TMP further I realized that there are numerous places where it can be used to improve performance.

Initially, I found that there were not may resources on TMP and that the syntax was challenging at first. I have documented the Nano code heavily, and have provided some examples of TMP on my blog so that anyone starting with TMP will (hopefully) find Nano, and its source code, useful.
